data.Sentence_cn: 19世纪最不寻常的建筑也许要数水晶宫了，
data.Sentence: Perhaps the most extraordinary building of the nineteenth century was the Crystal Palace,

data.Sentence_cn: 它是为1851年的“世界博览会”而建在海德公园的。
data.Sentence: which was built in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition of 1851.

data.Sentence_cn: 这座水晶宫不同于世界上所有的其他建筑，因为它是用钢和玻璃建成的。
data.Sentence: The Crystal Palace was different from all other buildings in the world, for it was made of iron and glass.

data.Sentence_cn: 它是有史以来最高大的建筑物之一，因此，人们从各个国家纷纷前来参观。
data.Sentence: It was one of the biggest buildings of all time and a lot of people from many countries came to see it.

data.Sentence_cn: 大量的商品从世界各地运送到了博览会，
data.Sentence: A great many goods were sent to the exhibition from various parts of the world.
There was also a great deal of machinery on display.

data.Sentence_cn: 其中最奇妙的是内史密斯的蒸汽锤。
data.Sentence: The most wonderful piece of machinery on show was Nasmyth's steam hammer.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管在当时旅行不像现在这么容易，但汽船还是把成千上万的参观者从欧洲大陆送过了英吉利海峡。
data.Sentence: Though in those days, travelling was not as easy as it is today, steam boats carried thousands of visitors across the Channel from Europe.

data.Sentence_cn: 一到英国，火车就把他们送到了水晶宫。
data.Sentence: On arriving in England, they were taken to the Crystal Palace by train.

data.Sentence_cn: 参观的人数总共是600万。博览会的赢利用来建造博物馆和高等学校。
data.Sentence: There were six million visitors in all, and the profits from the exhibition were used to build museums and colleges.

data.Sentence_cn: 后来，“水晶宫”被移到了伦敦南部。
data.Sentence: Later, the Crystal Palace was moved to South London.

data.Sentence_cn: 在1936年被焚毁之前，它一直是世界上最著名的建筑物之一。
data.Sentence: It remained one of the most famous buildings in the world until it was burnt down in 1936.
